clinical_study.brief_title: Use of a Smartphone Mobile Application (App) to Enhance Smoking Cessation Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: Use of a Smartphone Mobile Application (App) to Enhance Smoking Cessation Treatment - A Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock:
The goal of this research study is to compare the effectiveness of 2 different smartphone applications (apps). The apps are designed to help you quit smoking in combination with tobacco cessation (quitting) counseling.
This is an investigational study.
Up to 24 participants will be enrolled in this study. All will take part at MD Anderson.

detailed_description.textblock:
Study Groups:
If you are eligible and agree to take part, you will be randomly assigned (as in the flip of a coin) to 1 of 2 study groups. This is done because no one knows if one study group is better, the same, or worse than the other group. Each group will receive a different app designed to help you quit smoking:
- If you are in Group 1, your app is designed to help you learn relaxation skills.
- If you are in Group 2, your app is designed to help you improve your mood and increase your level of enjoyable activities.
The study staff will help you download your assigned app and will instruct you in how to use it. There is no charge for this app but data rates may apply as you use it, depending on your phone plan. You may also receive text messages reminding you to use the app.
Study Procedures:
The study staff will call you every 2 weeks. The last call will be about 6 weeks from today. Each call will take about 15 minutes, and you will be asked to provide honest answers to questions about your mood and your cigarette smoking. You may be able to complete some questionnaires electronically in advance of the visit with a secure link that will be sent to your email address or phone.
About 8 weeks from today, you will return to complete an interview with the study staff and complete questionnaires. Topics included will be depression, your emotions, your activity levels, your smoking patterns, your satisfaction with the app, and your dependence on smoking. This visit is expected to last about 60-75 minutes.
If you report that you are not smoking, you may be asked to take a carbon monoxide test like you did at screening.
Length of Study Participation:
After your 8-week visit, your participation in this study will be complete.
If at any point the study staff or a member of the Tobacco Treatment Program believes you are serious danger of hurting yourself or someone else, they may take steps to ensure your safety with the help of the Tobacco Treatment Program medical team.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. MD Anderson patient between the ages of 18 to 65
2. Current smoker (i.e., at least 10 cigarettes/day)
3. Smoking for at least one year
4. Carbon monoxide (CO) level of 5 ppm or greater, confirming smoking status
5. Willing to set a quit date in the next 30 days
6. Not engaged in smoking cessation treatment other than the MDACC Tobacco Treatment Program
7. Currently elevated depressive symptoms; (PHQ 2 > 2)
8. English speaking and ability to read and comprehend English
9. 9) currently own an iOS mobile phone (iPhone) using iOS 9.0 or later and reports regular use (at least weekly) of at least 1 iOS app
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Endorsing current suicidal ideation or intent
2. Meeting criteria for a current Major Depressive Episode measured by the PHQ-9
3. Any medical or psychiatric condition, illness, disorder, or concomitant medication that could compromise participant safety or treatment, as determined by the Principal Investigator or Collaborator
4. Subject considered by the investigator an unsuitable candidate for receipt of a smoking cessation treatment or unstable to be followed up throughout the entire duration of the study
